page.title: 18Farming (sheet 1)
page.content: About one third of our D-block lies within the boundary of the Blackmoor Estate. The estate is owned by the third Lord Selborne. It was founded about 120 years ago by Sir Roundell Palmer, the first Lord Selborne. He bought up the small local farms as they became available, and made an estate of about 2500 acres, or 1000 hectares. Land and Drainage Costs. 1868 the land was valued at Â£20 per acre and the cost of drainage was Â£14 per acre. 1968 the land was valued at Â£100 per acre and the cost of drainage was Â£200 to Â£300 per acre. 1985 the land is valued at Â£2000 per acre and the cost of drainage is Â£400 per acre.
